meanings.sent1: After smudging the picture, she had to redraw it.
meanings.sent2: I will redraw the map to make it clearer.
meanings.sent3: He tried to redraw his failed attempt at a smiley face.
meanings.sent4: She had to redraw the boundaries of her artwork after spilling paint.
meanings.sent5: The artist had to redraw the portrait to capture the subject's true essence.

meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the students to redraw their favorite animal.
meanings.sent2: I will redraw the diagram to show the correct connections.
meanings.sent3: He decided to redraw his doodle into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: She had to redraw the flower to get the shading just right.
meanings.sent5: The architect had to redraw the building plans to accommodate the new requirements.

meanings.definition: To make a new drawing of.
meanings.sent1: She had to redraw the landscape to include the mountains.
meanings.sent2: I will redraw the logo to make it more modern.
meanings.sent3: He had to redraw the cartoon character with a bigger smile.
meanings.sent4: She had to redraw the house to add more details.
meanings.sent5: The illustrator had to redraw the book cover to match the author's vision.
